In a message dated 2/7/2004 4:00:45 PM Central Standard Time, 
jggilbert@... writes:
Milt,
I've been out of town for a while.  The color of the base metal and the 
rubbed gold overlay look like what's found in the so-called Ezo fittings.  Most of 
these are menuki and saya kanemono, some of which are quite old.  I can't 
recall seeing an Ezo kozuka.  It'd be an interesting piece to see in person.  We 
had a nice pair of Ezo menuki at the London shinsa that were assigned to the 
early Muromachi period.

Jim
thanks Jim !!
Will bring to Sept Chicago shinsa  und find out once and for all.

milt
